template.description: Parse BMP image files.
Parse WAV audio files.
Parse ZIP archive files.

script.description: Determines if the currently open file contains only ASCII characters (byte range 0..127). If a non-ASCII byte is found, the cursor is moved to the first byte.
Executes a paste operation a number of times. The user can enter the number of times to paste in an input box.

Assigns a set of random byte values to a file. If a selection is made only the selected bytes are modified, otherwise the whole file is modified. The user can enter a minimum and maximum value to generate.

Split a large file into a number of smaller files. The user must specify the number of bytes per created file and also provide the filename of the first file. Note that the filename must contain numbers (e.g. 'c:\temp\file.bmp.001' or 'c:\temp\file0000.dat').

Reassembles files that were split with the SplitFile.1sc script. Open the first file in the file sequence with the file dialog that is displayed. The file name must contain numbers (e.g. 'c:\temp\file.bmp.001'). The joined file will be created as a new file.
Contains utility functions for packing or unpacking a set of strings into an array. Includes an example.

Demonstrates how to batch process a set of files. Takes as input a text file containing a list of file names, one per line. Opens each file in the list, performs processing on the file (in this case does an MD5 checksum) and then closes the file.
Functions for converting from a binary string to an integer and vise versa. Note that 010 Editor v4 now contains the built-in functions IntToBinaryStr and BinaryStrToInt.
Compares the current text line with the next line and sets bookmarks at characters which differ, marking them red.
Conversion of an array of bytes to integer types (short, int, int64).
Copies the current selection to the clipboard as hex bytes in a format suitable for inclusion in an assembly program. If no selection is made the whole file is copied.
Copies the currently selected bytes to the clipboard in binary format. Note that this functionality is now built into 010 Editor using 'Copy > Copy As > Copy as Binary Text'.

Copies the selection to the clipboard as hex bytes suitable for inclusion in an C/C++ program. If no selection is made the whole file is copied. Note that this functionality is now built into 010 Editor using 'Copy > Copy As > Copy as C Code'.
Copy selection or entire file to the clipboard as Pascal code. The text copied into the clipboard contains a Pascal constant definition, followed by the data as Hex bytes in Pascal notation.
Copy selection or entire file as Python code. Counts number of bytes and the Python Data Array is also copied to the Clipboard.
This script finds blocks of identical characters within the file or within the selection. Results are stored in bookmarks and printed in the output pane. Block size is defined by the variable LIMIT.
Creates files with up to 1 million characters for the use as input in data fields to check the data boundaries.

Decode the selected bytes or the entire file from Base64 code into binary. Base64 is a code used in email attachments or similar purposes, for to transfer binary data, where only ASCII data can be transmitted. In each character are placed 6 bits. This script extracts from the characters the least significant 6 bits and puts it together to whole bytes. Note that some of this functionality is now built directly into 010 Editor.
Deletes all columns in a text file between the start and end of the selection.
List all ASCII and Unicode strings in a file. Note that this functionality is now built into 010 Editor using 'Search > Find Strings'.
Erase repeated BLANK_LINES, BLANKs or lines including selected texts in files.
Encode bytes to Base64. Note this functionality is now included in 010 Editor using 'Copy > Copy As > Copy as Base64' or 'File > Export Hex'.
Displays the entropy value for a file or selection. The more random the file looks, the more the entropy value approaches 8.0 (its maximum value).
Finds the first byte with a different value than the current byte. Allows to skip large blocks filled with the same value. Search direction is down.
Finds the first byte which differs from the byte under current cursor position. Allows to skip large blocks filled with the same value. This version searches down and uses regular expressions.
Finds the first byte with a different value than the current byte. Allows skipping large blocks filled with the same byte. Search direction is up.
Finds the first byte with a different value than the current byte. Allows skipping large blocks filled with the same byte. Search direction is up and uses regular expressions.
Find all occurrences of bytes stored in the clipboard. Creates bookmarks for all occurrences found.
Finds the nearest bookmarks to the cursor. Places the cursor at the previous bookmark and optionally selects bytes to the next bookmark.
Find the first occurrence of the bytes stored in the clipboard. The bytes found are selected and the cursor is positioned after or before the selection according to the search direction.
Prints out all text lines in a file that are longer than a certain tolerance.
Fuzz a file by overwriting random locations.
Utility functions to extract the file name from a file path, or to look up a file index from a file name. Note that 010 Editor now contains the built-in functions FileNameGetBase and FindOpenFile.
Formats a 16 byte sequence as a Microsoft GUID, prints the result and then copies the result to the clipboard.
Convert hex data to ascii string. Eg. 01020304 -> "\x01\x02\x03\x04".
Imports a set of bookmarks from a CSV file.
Imports a CSV file exported from a Find All operation and creates bookmarks for each occurrence.
Inserts the specified tag into a TIFF image, updating the necessary attributes and offsets accordingly.
Interleaves the bytes of two files together. See Uninterleave.1sc to separate the interleaved file.
%u encode the selected bytes (little endian), similar to JavaScript's escape function.
Decodes a %u encoding, similar to JavaScript's unescape function.
Reverse nibbles of data. Eg. DF C2 A1 --->to ---> FD 2C 1A.
A set of functions to help parsing CSV data with an example. Other separator than "," can be specified.
Generate a 010 script to patch a file based on differences. The files must be the same size.
Demonstrates how to do a quicksort on an array.
Treats a file as a set of blocks and searches for a pattern at the beginning of each block. Could be used, for example, to search for a pattern at the beginning of each disk sector.
ROT-13 decoder/encoder of the selected block.
Searches at the start of each sector for a value. Moves the cursor to the next occurrence every time the script is run.
Sets all letters in the selection to lower case. Note this functionality is now built into 010 Editor using 'Format > Lowercase'.
Sets the first letter of the selection to upper case and all following letters to lower case. Note this functionality is now built into 010 Editor using 'Format > Capitalize'.
Sets all letters in the selection to upper case. Note this functionality is now built into 010 Editor using 'Format > Uppercase'.
Sort (and optionally remove duplicate) lines in a text file in ascending order.
Add a number to each character of the selected string or whole file.
Utility function for searching for a value within a string and replacing it with another value.
Utility for reversing a string.
Creates all upper/lower case combinations of a string and writes them to a file.
When given an interleaved file, this script creates two files by separating the interleaved data. See Interleave.1sc for the reverse operation.
Convert %xx in a URL to a char. Eg. AAA%3DCCC => AAA=CCC.
Xors the current selection with a set of bytes, which causes the bytes to be encoded so they cannot be read by a human. Run the Xor again on the encoded selection to decode the data.
Similar to XORSelection.1sc but you can enter the XOR key in HEX style.

template.description: Define a template for parsing AndroidManifest.xml binary files.
Parse an AVI movie file.
template.comment: Updated header for repository submission, added coloring for header.

template.description: Parse ISO Base Media File Format files (QuickTime, JPEG2000, MPEG-4, etc.). See also the MP4.bt template.
template.comment: Updated header for repository submission, renamed file.

template.description: Template for Microsoft cabinet format files.
template.comment: Updated header for repository submission, added coloring for header, removed some warnings.

template.description: Parse java card CAP file with bytecode disassembler (Java Card 2.2.2 specs compliance).
Simple CDA file template to read Audio CD header information.
Parse Java Class (JVM) files.
A template for parsing Java Class (JVM) Files. Includes visualizing bytecode.
Template for packaged Google Chrome extensions. Basically a copy of ZIP.bt with extra bits for Google Chrome extensions.
Parses .dbf (database) format files.
A template for analyzing Dalvik VM (Android) DEX files.
Template to parse the header of a Microsoft memory dump file (DMP) as produced by the debugger and kernel crashdump facility.
Template for EDID files (Extended display identification data).
template.idbytes: 00 FF FF FF FF FF FF 00

template.description: Decode the ELF format for both 32/64 bit in big/little endian, decode the elf, program, and section headers. Also decode the dynamic symbol table entries. Many fields implement custom viewers but do not handle writing from those views.
View the file system headers in an El Torito bootable cd image.
Enhanced Metafile Format (EMF) template.
Template for parsing the Embedded OpenType (EOT) font file format.
Decomposes Video Symbol Stream Files for E-8VSB modulation as per ATSC Digital Television Standard (A/53).
Parse Windows executable exe, dll, and sys files. Supports 32 and 64 bit.
template.comment: Merged changes from PETemplate.bt and EXETemplate2.bt and renamed to this file. Added some coloring and rearranged for readability. Update header for repository submission.

template.description: Template for Flash Video (FLV) files.
Defines a template for parsing GIF image files.

Template for the GOCLEVER GPS Navigation log format GPSLogYYYY-MM-DD_xx-xx-xx.bin (Model GC-4335 and others). Generates report in the human readable form: Date, Longitude, Latitude, Geoid, Altitude, Direction.
Quick template for parsing GZip data/files.
template.comment: Updated header for repository submission, added open attribute.

template.description: Defines a template for parsing icon image files.

Demonstrates how to add a series of dates to the Auto Inspector. Includes: WebkitTime (64-bit int, microseconds since 01/01/1601), HFSTime (32-bit int, seconds since 01/01/1904), AppleTime (32-bit int, seconds since 01/01/2001), PRTime (64-bit int, microseconds since 01/01/1970), JavaTime (64-bit int, microseconds since 01/01/1970), GPSTime (32-bit int, seconds since 01/06/1980), BlackberryDate (32-bit int, minutes since 01/01/1900).

Adds MP4_Time to the Inspector template. This template may be used to customize the auto tab of the Inspector with your own variables. See the Inspector section of the Options dialog for more information.
Parse the file system headers for ISO disk images.
Template for JPG image files.
template.comment: Updated header for repository submission, added open attribute.

template.description: View data in a Microsoft shortcut (LNK) file.
template.comment: Updated header for repository submission, added read function for StringData.

template.description: Template for LUKS (Linux Unified Key Setup) hard disk encryption.
Quick template for parsing Mach-o binaries, including Mac OS X executables, .o and .dylib files.
template.idbytes: CF FA ED FE, CE FA ED FE, BE BA FE CA, CA FE BA BE

template.description: General MIDI sound file template. Complete with delta-time and BPM evaluation into local variables.
Mifare Classic 1k Structure parsing. Commonly used in smart cards.
Mifare Classic 4k Structure parsing. Commonly used in smart cards.
Parse Amazon Kindle ebook mobipocket file formats .mobi, .azw, .prc.
Parse an MP3 music file.
Defines a template for parsing MP4 and MOV video files.
Parses Cisco's Netflow Version 5 format.
Parses the ogg container format.
Analyse OrCad 3.20a library files.
Analyse drawings and blocks from OrCad 3.20a programs.
Template for binary journal file used in AppleOne POS.
Parses a Microsoft PAL palette file.
Parse a PCAP network capture file.
Parse a PCX bitmap header.
Template for Adobe PDF (Portable Document Format) files.
Parse a PNG (Portable Network Graphics) image file.

template.description: Parses a WSUS PSF (Patch Storage File) file.
Parse python bytecode .pyc and .pyo files, support python 2.4 to 2.7.
Parse RAR archives including 2.x, 3.x and SFX RAR files.
Defines a template for parsing QQ's RDB files.
Parses Windows Registry hive structures. Includes Header, nk, vk, sk, and list records. Data node records are skipped.
Template for Windows registry policy files (registry.pol).
Parses resources structure of a RES file or a PE file with the .rsrc section.
Template for parsing and reverse engineering RomFS images used in embedded devices.
Parses ESRI shp files.

template.description: Parses ESRI shx files.
Defines a template for parsing images of emulated Sinclair Microdrive cartridges.
Motorola S-REC format template. This should work with the S-REC formats based on S1-S9.

template.description: Define a template for parsing SmartSniff Packet files.
Parse an STL binary file containing 3D geometry (CAD).
Template for all the Tacx Fortius cycling training software file formats, including pgmf, caf, imf, rlv and mrlv.
Shows the fields of a TGA image.

The WinHex (editor by X-Ways Software Technology AG) stores the find results in the winhex.pos file. This template parses its structure and allows to build a script to convert WinHex results into a set of bookmarks for 010Editor.
A template for parsing TIFF (Tagged Image File Format) files. Also now handles GeoTIFF files.
Template to make sense of, and modifications to, Eudora 7.* (possible older versions too) mailbox index files (.toc).
Template to parse TTF (TrueType) fonts.
Interpret entries in utmp and wtmp login log files on *nix systems.
Defines an advanced template for parsing WAV audio files. Includes SMPL chunk parsing (Parsing wav files that contains Sustain Loops. Useful for Game Developers).
Parse the Windows Metafile (WMF) graphics file format.
template.comment: Updated header for repository submission, added coloring for header, removed some warnings.

template.description: Defines a template for parsing ZIP files. Handles more complex ZIP data such as ZIP64 that the base ZIP.bt cannot read.
Microsoft VHD virtual disk format parser.
Defines a template for parsing Adobe Flash SWF files based on the file format specification for Flash 9.
Defines a template for SF2 (SoundFont 2.04) files.
Defines a template for generic RIFF files.

script.description: Deletes all empty lines in the selection. If no lines are selected all empty lines in the file are deleted.

script.description: Encode current selection by shifting characters. Supported encodings: ROT-5, ROT-13, ROT-47, Caesar and custom shifts. The complete file is encoded when nothing is selected.

template.description: Parse nus3 music archives.
Parse shpc animation archives.

Parse logical and physical drives including MBR, FAT12, FAT16, FAT32, exFAT, HFS, NTFS and extended partitions. Can display subdirectories and data for individual files. Note that some NTFS drives may not work properly (see file comments).
template.comment: Add support for exFAT and 4k native sector sizes.

template.description: Parse the file system headers for ISO disk images, and print directory tree.
template.comment: A significantly re-write as far as listing directory tree. Used free ECMA-119, 3rd Edition (2017) spec. as reference.
